Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Circular, olive-green to black spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs. Lesions develop a velvety appearance and can cause premature leaf drop.
Apple___Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or sulfur during early stages of infection. Prune infected branches and remove fallen plant debris.
Apple___Apple_scab.prevention: Plant resistant apple varieties like Liberty or Freedom. Maintain proper tree spacing, ensure good air circulation, and practice annual sanitation by removing fallen leaves and fruit.

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Brown, circular spots on leaves that expand and develop concentric rings. Fruit develops black, sunken lesions.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing captan or mancozeb. Prune infected branches and remove mummified fruit.
Apple___Black_rot.prevention: Practice good sanitation, remove infected plant material, and maintain proper tree spacing.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Yellow-orange spots on leaves that develop into raised, rust-colored pustules on the underside.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or propiconazole. Remove nearby cedar trees if possible.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and maintain good air circulation around trees.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular to elliptical spots with tan centers and dark borders on leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb when symptoms first appear.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot.prevention: Practice crop rotation, remove crop debris, and maintain proper plant spacing.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust.symptoms: Small, circular to elongated pustules that are reddish-brown in color on both leaf surfaces.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole when symptoms first appear.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and maintain proper plant spacing for good air circulation.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Long, elliptical, gray-green lesions that turn tan with age. Lesions may have dark borders.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole when symptoms first appear.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and remove crop debris after harvest.

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Circular, reddish-brown spots on leaves that develop black fruiting bodies. Berries shrivel and turn black.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or myclobutanil. Remove and destroy infected plant material.
Grape___Black_rot.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, maintain good air circulation, and remove fallen leaves and fruit.

Grape___Esca.symptoms: Yellowing and scorching of leaves, dark streaks in wood, and berry shriveling.
Grape___Esca.treatment: No effective chemical treatment. Remove and destroy infected vines. Make clean pruning cuts.
Grape___Esca.prevention: Plant certified disease-free stock, practice proper pruning techniques, and maintain vine health.

Grape___Leaf_blight.symptoms: Small, circular spots on leaves that expand and develop dark centers with yellow halos.
Grape___Leaf_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or copper when symptoms first appear.
Grape___Leaf_blight.prevention: Maintain good air circulation, remove infected leaves, and practice proper vine spacing.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, stems, and tubers.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected plant material.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Plant certified seed potatoes, practice crop rotation, and maintain proper plant spacing.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves that expand rapidly. White fungal growth may appear.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected plants.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant certified seed potatoes, practice crop rotation, and avoid overhead irrigation.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves, stems, and fruit that may develop yellow halos.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove and destroy infected plant material.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Plant disease-free seed, practice crop rotation, and avoid overhead irrigation.

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, stems, and fruit.
Tomato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and maintain proper plant spacing.

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems. White fungal growth may appear.
Tomato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected plants.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and avoid overhead irrigation.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with grayish-purple mold on the underside.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Maintain good air circulation, avoid overhead irrigation, and practice proper plant spacing.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders and light centers on leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Practice crop rotation, remove crop debris, and maintain proper plant spacing.

Tomato___Spider_mites.symptoms: Fine webbing on leaves, yellow stippling, and leaf drop.
Tomato___Spider_mites.treatment: Apply miticides or insecticidal soap. Remove heavily infested leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites.prevention: Maintain proper humidity, remove weeds, and monitor plants regularly.

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Circular spots with concentric rings and yellow halos on leaves and fruit.
Tomato___Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Target_Spot.prevention: Practice crop rotation, remove crop debris, and maintain proper plant spacing.
